mysql

Class DBConnection

  • java.lang.Object
    • mysql.DBConnection

  • public class DBConnection
extends java.lang.Object
    class to connect to a MySQL database and to write data into a database
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Holger Ebhart

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DBConnection(java.lang.String hostName, java.lang.String port, java.lang.String dbName, java.lang.String userName, java.lang.String password)
      configurate the connection to the database

    • Method Summary

      inserts a new location into the database
      int writeRetweet(long id, int location, java.util.Date date)
      inserts a retweet into the database, if it's still in the database the counter will be increased

      • DBConnection

        public DBConnection(java.lang.String hostName,
            java.lang.String port,
            java.lang.String dbName,
            java.lang.String userName,
            java.lang.String password)
             throws java.lang.InstantiationException,
                    java.lang.IllegalAccessException,
                    java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        configurate the connection to the database
        Parameters:
        hostName - the haostname of the mysql database as String
        port - the port of the mysql database as String
        dbName - the database-name as String
        userName - the user name for the mysql database as String
        password - the password for the mysql database as String
        Throws:
        java.lang.InstantiationException
        java.lang.IllegalAccessException
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException

    • Method Detail

      • connect

        public void connect()
             throws java.sql.SQLException
        starts the connection to the database
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - thrown if there is no connection to the database possible

      • disconnect

        public void disconnect()
        cuts the connection to the database off

      • writeAccount

        public int[] writeAccount(java.lang.String name,
                 long id,
                 boolean isVer,
                 int follower,
                 java.lang.String location,
                 java.util.Date date)
                   throws java.sql.SQLException
        inserts an account into the database
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the account as String
        id - the official twitter id of the account as long
        isVer - true if the account is verified, else false
        follower - the number of followers as int
        location - the location of the account as String
        date - the date of the tweet as Date
        Returns:
        integer-array with two results of the database requests. First is result for adding the account, second is for adding the tweet. Database-request result is 0 if request was successfully, 'other' if line 'other' has been modified (no success)
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • writeRetweet

        public int writeRetweet(long id,
               int location,
               java.util.Date date)
                 throws java.sql.SQLException
        inserts a retweet into the database, if it's still in the database the counter will be increased
        Parameters:
        id - the id of the account who's tweet was retweeted as long
        location - TO COMPLETE
        day - the day when the retweet has been written as Date
        Returns:
        database-request result as Integer (0 if request successfully, 'other' if line 'other' has been modified (no success))
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException
